medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began at 7 weeks of age (3.5 months before the current admission) with abdominal breathing and grunting respirations developing during the night after a missed feeding. His mother reported he had consumed less breast milk than usual and awoke with heavy breathing as well as grunting respirations. There had been occasional irritability and tachypnea after missed feedings over the past 2 weeks, resolving after feeding.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of a small umbilical hernia and gastroesophageal reflux disease. No known allergies. Medications included ranitidine and vitamin D.
medical_history.family_history: Paternal grandmother had type 2 diabetes mellitus.
medical_history.social_history: Patient lives with parents, older sister, and pet dog; does not attend day care.
